DataElement.preferredName: Immediate Family History Endometrial Cancer Diagnosis Age 50 Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text that describes the age at which the family member was diagnosed with endometrial or uterine cancer in relationship to their 50th birthday.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives. A patient's family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions._A malignant tumor arising from the epithelium that lines the cavity of the uterine body.  The vast majority of endometrial carcinomas are adenocarcinomas; squamous cell and adenosquamous carcinomas represent a minority of the cases.  Endometrioid adenocarcinoma is the most frequently seen variant of endometrial adenocarcinoma.  Uterine bleeding is an initial clinical sign.  The prognosis depends on the stage of the tumor, the depth of myometrial wall invasion, and the degree of differentiation. -- 2004_Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Chronological record of health and disease events of family members and ancestors. (WEBS84):A malignant tumor arising from the epithelium that lines the cavity of the uterine body.  The vast majority of endometrial carcinomas are adenocarcinomas; squamous cell and adenosquamous carcinomas represent a minority of the cases.  Endometrioid adenocarcinoma is the most frequently seen variant of endometrial adenocarcinoma.  Uterine bleeding is an initial clinical sign.  The prognosis depends on the stage of the tumor, the depth of myometrial wall invasion, and the degree of differentiation. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives. A patient's family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions.

A malignant tumor arising from the epithelium that lines the cavity of the uterine body.  The vast majority of endometrial carcinomas are adenocarcinomas; squamous cell and adenosquamous carcinomas represent a minority of the cases.  Endometrioid adenocarcinoma is the most frequently seen variant of endometrial adenocarcinoma.  Uterine bleeding is an initial clinical sign.  The prognosis depends on the stage of the tumor, the depth of myometrial wall invasion, and the degree of differentiation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval by S.Shakour and D.Reeves 12/1/11 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth._A number with no fractional part.::50_Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.: A number with no fractional part.::50: The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.

A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
